Legal_Issue: Whether Compulife's expungement application under s. 57 of the Trade-marks Act can be stayed pending its infringement action
Governing_Law: Trade-marks Act, s. 57; Federal Court Act, s. 50(1)
Procedural_Stage: Motion to stay or join proceedings
Evidence_Assessment: No clear prejudice or injustice shown by Compuoffice
Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay and joinder dismissed
Burden_of_Proof: On Compuoffice to demonstrate prejudice or injustice
Legal_Rule: A stay is granted only if continuation causes prejudice/injustice to the defendant and does not unjustly affect the plaintiff
Standard_of_Review: Prejudice or injustice standard under s. 50(1) of the Federal Court Act
Procedural_Issue: Request for stay and joinder of proceedings
Grounds_for_Claim: Duplication and judicial inefficiency alleged by Compuoffice
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Extension of time granted to Compuoffice to file reply evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of expungement (in rem) vs. infringement (in personam) proceedings
Legal_Framework: Distinction between in rem and in personam actions in trademark law
Applicant_Challenge: Compulife's dual proceedings: infringement and expungement
Court_Result: Denial of stay and joinder; extension of time for Compuoffice
Defendant_Response: Compuoffice sought stay based on duplication and inefficiency
Outcome: Motion denied; 40-day extension granted for filing evidence
Remedy_Sought: Stay of expungement proceeding pending infringement action
Legal_Provision: s. 57, Trade-marks Act; s. 50(1), Federal Court Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Trade-marks Act, s. 57; Federal Court Act, s. 50(1)
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Expungement application and infringement action ongoing
